alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 08 at 7:26PM MDT until August 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 725 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 15 miles south of Boyero, or 40 miles south of Flagler, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and hail up to two inches in diameter. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
